org.jetel.graph

Interface InputPortDirect

  • All Superinterfaces:
    InputPort
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConcurrentInputPort, Edge, JobflowEdge

    public interface InputPortDirect
extends InputPort
    An interface defining operations expected from InputPortDirect object This interface is complementary to InputPort. In order to work properly, initialization/opening of port must be first done through InputPort interface calls.
    Since:
    August 13, 2002
    See Also:
    InputPort

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean readRecordDirect(java.nio.ByteBuffer record)
      Deprecated. 
      use readRecordDirect(CloverBuffer) instead
      boolean readRecordDirect(CloverBuffer record)
      An operation that reads one record from this port - in its serialized (binary form).

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jetel.graph.InputPort

        connectReader, getByteCounter, getEdge, getInputByteCounter, getInputPortNumber, getInputRecordCounter, getMetadata, getReaderWaitingTime, getRecordCounter, getUsedMemory, getWriter, hasData, isEOF, isOpen, readRecord, reset

    • Method Detail

      • readRecordDirect

        boolean readRecordDirect(CloverBuffer record)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.InterruptedException
        An operation that reads one record from this port - in its serialized (binary form).
        The passed-in object (content) is cleared first (using CloverBuffer.clear()). When data is stored in it, CloverBuffer.flip() operation is called upon it - it is ready to be read when method call ends.
        Parameters:
        record - CloverBuffer into which data should be stored
        Returns:
        True if success, otherwise false (when no more data available)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If reading failed during method call
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If thread waiting to be notified was interrupted
        Since:
        April 2, 2002

      • readRecordDirect

        @Deprecated
boolean readRecordDirect(java.nio.ByteBuffer record)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.InterruptedException
        Deprecated. use readRecordDirect(CloverBuffer) instead
        An operation that reads one record from this port - in its serialized (binary form).
        The passed-in object (content) is cleared first (using ByteBuffer.clear()). When data is stored in it, ByteBuffer.flip() operation is called upon it - it is ready to be read when method call ends.
        Parameters:
        record - ByteBuffer into which data should be stored
        Returns:
        True if success, otherwise false (when no more data available)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If reading failed during method call
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If thread waiting to be notified was interrupted
        Since:
        April 2, 2002
